Get-AzureSiteRecoveryServer

ID : f5e713fe-5b6d-4641-9690-6fe74c976b8e Name : Server2.contoso.com LastHeartbeat : 8/13/2014 2:28:58 PM ProviderVersion : 3.5 ServerVersion : 3.2.7510.0

maml:description.maml:para: Get-AzureSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlanFile download the recovery plan in an XML format. This file can be updated and used to upload the updated Recovery Plan.

Get-AzureSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlanFile download the recovery plan in an XML format. This file can be updated and used to upload the updated Recovery Plan. A recovery plan gathers virtual machines in a group for the purposes of failover and recovery
Id of the recovery Plan
Path to store the recovery plan xml file
Path to store the recovery plan xml file
Recovery Plan object
Id of the recovery Plan
Path to store the recovery plan xml file
Recovery Plan object

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, site, recovery

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $Rp = Get-AzureSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlan; Get-AzureSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlanFile -RecoveryPlan $Rp -Path C:\Users\Contoso\Desktop\RP.xml

Get-AzureSiteRecoveryVaultSettings

maml:description.maml:para: The Get-AzureSiteRecoveryProtectionContainer cmdlet gets protected containers for the current Microsoft Azure Site Recovery vault. A protected container is a logical container for protected objects such as virtual machines. Azure Site Recovery configures replication settings for protected containers

Get information about Azure site recovery Protection container under current Azure Site Recovery Vault. A protection container is the logical container for protection entities on which replication settings can be configured
Specifies the ID of a protected container to get.
Name of the Protection Container
Specifies the ID of a protected container to get.
Name of the Protection Container

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, site, recovery

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureSiteRecoveryProtectionContainer
Name : PrimaryCloud ID : fd00d920-79e4-4f2d-a282-a779c0cecb7f_ce995917-c962-45d0-b7f3-9f408a4e1429 FabricObjectId : fd00d920-79e4-4f2d-a282-a779c0cecb7f FabricType : VMM Type : VMM ServerId : fd00d920-79e4-4f2d-a282-a779c0cecb7f Role : Primary AvailableProtectionProfiles : {ab01dcbe-9da0-4c31-9564-d6904cfadfde, ad388147-83de-4d2f-a09d-fa46c626747e}

maml:description.maml:para: The Get-AzureSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet gets Microsoft Azure Site Recovery jobs. You can use this cmdlet to view the information of the operation for current Azure Site Recovery vault.
Get the information of the operation for current Azure Site Recovery Vault.
Specifies the ID of a job to get.
Specifies an Azure Site Recovery job object to get.

Specifies a end time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that ends after the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.

Specifies a start time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that begin after the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.
Specifies an input state for an Azure Site Recovery job. This cmdlet gets jobs that match the state that this parameter specifies.
ID of the object on which Job was targeted to.

Specifies a end time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that ends after the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.
Specifies the ID of a job to get.
Specifies an Azure Site Recovery job object to get.

Specifies a start time as a DateTime object. This cmdlet gets jobs that begin after the time that this parameter specifies. To obtain a DateTime object, use the Get-Date cmdlet. For more information, type Get-Help Get-Date.
Specifies an input state for an Azure Site Recovery job. This cmdlet gets jobs that match the state that this parameter specifies.
ID of the object on which Job was targeted to.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, site, recovery

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureSiteRecoveryJob -Id d0b56c01-1fd7-411a-94e9-be717ac6601e
ID : d0b56c01-1fd7-411a-94e9-be717ac6601e ClientRequestId : 0d259706-7882-4614-81bf-7d155f3600cb-2014-10-06 09:40:26Z State : Succeeded StateDescription : Completed StartTime : 10/6/2014 9:40:28 AM EndTime : 10/6/2014 9:40:30 AM AllowedActions : {Cancel, Restart} Name : Remove classification configuration Tasks : {Prerequisites check for unpairing classifications, Unpairing classifications} Errors : {}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$StartTime = Get-Date "2015-02-20 06:10:03Z" $EndTime = Get-Date "2015-02-20 06:20:03Z" Get-AzureSiteRecoveryJob -StartTime $StartTime -EndTime $EndTime
Name : SaveRecoveryPlan ID : 5d6389f7-3f08-48d6-9d2c-e4a4aed36a0b ClientRequestId : bc4b291d-4722-419e-a7a3-7a58674c35a3-2015-02-20 06:14:03Z State : Succeeded StateDescription : Completed StartTime : 2/20/2015 6:14:04 AM EndTime : 2/20/2015 6:14:05 AM TargetObjectId : 2d11e8be-29b8-4152-a8b9-2a6a9304537a TargetObjectType : RecoveryPlan TargetObjectName : TestRP AllowedActions : Tasks : {Save a recovery plan task} Errors : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Provide the DateTime object in UTC as input to StartTime and EndTime parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: Imports a Azure site Recovery Vault Settings file to able to connect to Azure site Recovery Vault

Imports a Azure site Recovery Vault Settings file to able to connect to Azure site Recovery Vault. The Vault settings file can be downloaded from Azure site recovery Vault by logging on the Azure portal
Path to the Azure site Recovery Vault Settings file. This file can be downloaded from Azure Site Recovery Vault portal and stored locally
Path to the Azure site Recovery Vault Settings file. This file can be downloaded from Azure Site Recovery Vault portal and stored locally

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, site, recovery

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Import-AzureSiteRecoveryVaultSettingsFile -Path "C:\Users\Contoso\Contosovault Monday, October 6, 2014.VaultCredentials"
VERBOSE: Vault Settings File path: C:\Users\Contoso\Contosovault Monday, October 6, 2014.VaultCredentials
ResourceName CloudServiceName ------------ ---------------- Contosovault RecoveryServices-6JP23WE3SKKOM5AFQG2YQAI22MNOWK52QDKWMUP...

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a Recovery Plan in to a current Azure Site Recovery Vault

Adds a Recovery Plan in to a current Azure Site Recovery Vault. A recovery plan gathers virtual machines in a group for the purposes of failover and recovery. Use Get-AzureSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlanFile commandlet on an existing Recovery Plan to view the RecoveryPlan file and know its format.
Recovery Plan file
Waits till the operation completes
Recovery Plan file
Waits till the operation completes

New-AzureSiteRecoveryRecoveryPlan -File C:\Users\contoso\Desktop\RP.xml

maml:description.maml:para: Restarts the Operation in Azure Site Recovery
Restarts the Operation in Azure Site Recovery . This cmdlet is allowed on failed and cancelled jobs . To know allowed actions on a job look for Allowed Actions in job object
Id of the Azure Site Recovery Job
Id of the Azure Site Recovery Job

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, site, recovery

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Restart-AzureSiteRecoveryJob -Id bbf0b839-9aaa-49e1-8354-601c9145966d
ID : bbf0b839-9aaa-49e1-8354-601c9145966d ClientRequestId : ef42c8b0-640c-4442-960b-349f83d161a5-2014-24-06 14:24:04Z-P State : Failed StateDescription : Failed StartTime : 10/6/2014 9:41:08 AM EndTime : 10/6/2014 9:41:21 AM AllowedActions : {Cancel, Restart} Name : Enable protection Tasks : {Prerequisites check for enabling protection , Identifying replication target, Enable replication, Starting initial replication...} Errors : {CreateProtectionTargetTask}

maml:description.maml:para: Resumes a suspended job in Azure Site Recovery
Resumes the Operation in Azure Site Recovery . This cmdlet is allowed on suspended jobs . To know allowed actions on a job look for Allowed Actions in job object
ID of the Azure Site Recovery Job
User comment can be specified while resuming the Job
ASR Job object
User comment can be specified while resuming the Job
User comment can be specified while resuming the Job
ID of the Azure Site Recovery Job
ASR Job object

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$jobs= Get-AzureSiteRecoveryJob; Resume-AzureSiteRecoveryJob -Job $jobs

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the Protection on a protection entity for Azure Site Recovery
Sets the Protection on a protection entity for Azure Site Recovery. This is async cmdlet which will only start the operation and return the job object.
ID of the protection entity
ID of the Protected Container
set 'Enable' to enable protection and 'Disable' to disable protection
Bypasses confirmation on passing
Waits till the operation completes
set 'Enable' to enable protection and 'Disable' to disable protection
Protection Entity object
Bypasses confirmation on passing
OS type e.g. Windows or Linux
Name of the disk containing operating system.
Protection profile to be used to enable protection.
Waits till the operation completes

set 'Enable' to enable protection and 'Disable' to disable protection

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azuresm, servicemanagement, management, service, site, recovery

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$PC = Get-AzureSiteRecoveryProtectionContainer -Name "Cloud1" $PE = Get-AzureSiteRecoveryProtectionEntity -ProtectionContainer $PC -Name "VM1" Set-AzureSiteRecoveryProtectionEntity -ProtectionEntity $PE -Protection Enable -ProtectionProfile $PC.AvailableProtectionProfiles[0] -OS Windows
Name : EnableDr ID : 7d980e67-ad8c-45bc-99a6-6d8ca0a4a689 ClientRequestId : d45eb812-de16-4bff-b4f4-a34ffa4afc5d-2015-02-18 15:31:12Z-P State : InProgress StateDescription : InProgress StartTime : 2/18/2015 3:31:16 PM EndTime : TargetObjectId : 52fa9f2d-57d4-4036-a46f-b112d2d6ae72 TargetObjectType : ProtectionEntity TargetObjectName : TestVM2 AllowedActions : Tasks : {Prerequisites check for enabling protection, Identifying the replication target, Enablereplication, Starting initial replication...} Errors : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: The OS Parameter is mandatory when an on-premise Hyper-v site is protected to azure

maml:description.maml:para: The Start-AzureSiteRecoveryTestFailoverJob cmdlet starts the test failover for a protection entity or for a recovery plan in Microsoft Azure Site Recovery. Check whether the job succeeds by using the Get-AzureSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet.

Start the Test Failover operation for a Protection Entity or Recovery Plan under Azure Site Recovery. This will start the test failover job and success of test failover can be tracked state of the Job using Get-AzureSiteRecoveryJob
Direction of the failover, either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary
Specifies the ID of a protected container. This cmdlet starts the job for a protected virtual machine that belongs to the container that this cmdlet specifies.

Specifies an ASRProtectionEntity object for which to start the job. To obtain a protection entity object, use the Get-AzureSiteRecoveryProtectionEntity cmdlet. This cmdlet starts a test failover for the protected entity that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the network type to be used for test failover.
Waits till the operation completes
Direction of the failover, either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary
Specifies the ID of the logical network.
Specifies the ID of a protected container. This cmdlet starts the job for a protected virtual machine that belongs to the container that this cmdlet specifies.

Specifies an ASRProtectionEntity object for which to start the job. To obtain a protection entity object, use the Get-AzureSiteRecoveryProtectionEntity cmdlet. This cmdlet starts a test failover for the protected entity that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the network type to be used for test failover.
Waits till the operation completes

Specifies the network object to be used for test failover.

Specifies the ID of the virtual machine network.

maml:description.maml:para: The Start-AzureSiteRecoveryUnplannedFailoverJob cmdlet starts the unplanned failover for a protectioned entity or for a recovery plan in Microsoft Azure Site Recovery. Check whether the job succeeds by using the Get-AzureSiteRecoveryJob cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Start the commit failover of the Azure Site Recovery object after failover
Start the commit failover of the Azure Site Recovery object after failover. This will start the commit and return the job object. Success of the job can be tracked using Get-AzureSiteRecoveryJob

ID : c38eecdc-731c-405b-a61c-08db99aae2fe ClientRequestId : 32ace403-0916-4967-83a1-529176bd6e88-2014-49-06 15:49:24Z-P State : NotStarted StateDescription : NotStarted StartTime : EndTime : AllowedActions : {} Name : Tasks : {} Errors : {}

maml:description.maml:para: Start the Planned Failover operation for a Protection Entity or Recovery Plan under Azure Site Recovery

Start the Planned Failover operation for a Protection Entity or Recovery Plan under Azure Site Recovery. This will start the failover and return the job object. Success of the job can be tracked using Get-AzureSiteRecoveryJob
Direction of the failover, either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary
Recovery Plan object

This parameter is applicable when Failover is done from Azure to on-premise site which requires a large data synchronization. Specify what synchronization has to optimize: ForDowntime: Synchronize data before failover (minimize downtime) Synchronization will be performed without shutting down the virtual machine. After synchronization is complete, the job would be suspended. Resume the job to do an additional synchronization that shuts down the virtual machine. ForSynchronization : data during failover only (minimize synchronization) With this setting enabled, the virtual machine will begin shutdown immediately. Synchronization will start after shutdown to complete the failover.
Waits till the operation completes
Direction of the failover, either PrimaryToRecovery or RecoveryToPrimary
Id of the Recovery Plan

After synchronization is complete, the job would be suspended. Resume the job to do an additional synchronization that shuts down the virtual machine. ForSynchronization : data during failover only (minimize synchronization) With this setting enabled, the virtual machine will begin shutdown immediately. Synchronization will start after shutdown to complete the failover.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a Protection profile object . This is an in memory object to be further supplied for Protection Profile related operations.
Creates a Protection profile object in memory. This command can be used to return a protection profile object to be further supplied for Protection Profile related operations.
Replication frequency interval in seconds. As of now, only three possible values supported. 30 seconds, 300 seconds, 900 seconds.
Type of Replication Provider either HyperVReplica or HyperVReplicaAzure.
Switch parameter indicating whether replica entity deletion is to be enabled.
Frequency of Application Consistent Snapshot in hours.
Type of authentication to be used. Possible values are Certificate and Kerberos.
Switch parameter indicating whether compression is to be Enabled.
Specify this to bypass the confirm action and take the default (Y).
Can be used to provide a name to the protection profile settings object that is to be created.
Number of hours to retain Recovery points.
Replication Method either Online - over the network or Offline.
Port on which the replication would take place.
Replication Start Time. It should be within the next 24 hours of the start of the job.
Azure Storage account name on which the Azure replica entity would be located.
Azure Subscription ID corresponding to the storage account on which the Azure replica entity would be located.
Replication frequency interval in seconds. As of now, only three possible values supported. 30 seconds, 300 seconds, 900 seconds.

Frequency of Application Consistent Snapshot in hours.
Specify this to bypass the confirm action and take the default (Y).
Can be used to provide a name to the protection profile settings object that is to be created.
Number of hours to retain Recovery points.

Switch parameter indicating whether compression is to be Enabled.

Port on which the replication would take place.
Type of Replication Provider either HyperVReplica or HyperVReplicaAzure.
Replication Start Time. It should be within the next 24 hours of the start of the job.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
New-AzureSiteRecoveryProtectionProfileObject -ReplicationProvider HyperVReplica -ReplicationMethod Online -ReplicationFrequencyInSeconds 30 -RecoveryPoints 2 -ApplicationConsistentSnapshotFrequencyInHours 1 -CompressionEnabled -ReplicationPort 8085 -ReplicationStartTime 1 -AllowReplicaDeletion
